availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard R. Hackney (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married Angeline Hackney. Father of Elizabeth Hackney, William Hackney, Mary Hackney, Jacob Hackney, Pendleton Hackney, and Sarah S. Hackney. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1850 and 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850 and 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 167; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 519; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 116; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 5; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Voting District 4, p. 11.
